2307520.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307520
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 001
2307520.text: Abu Ruhm, one of the Companions of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, who had offered his allegiance to the Prophet under the Tree [i.e. at Hudaybiyya] was heard to say, "I went on the expedition to Tabuk with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. While we were travelling at night at al-Akhdar, I was near to the Prophet. A deep sleepiness overcame us, but I began to wake up when my camel wandered near to the Prophet's camel. I was worried that when it came close, it would his foot in the stirrup. I began to pull my camel back, but at a certain point in the night I feel asleep. Then my camel jostled against the camel of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, while his foot was in stirrup, hitting his foot. I did not wake up until he exclaimed, 'Ow!' I said, 'Messenger of Allah, ask for forgiveness for me!' The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, 'Never mind.'

2307530.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307530
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 002
2307530.text: 'A'isha said, "A man asked for permission to come in to see the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and the Prophet remarked, 'He is a bad brother of his tribe.' When the man came in, the Prophet was cheerful towards him. I asked the Prophet about that and he said, 'Allah does not love anyone who is obscene and coarse.'"

2307540.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307540
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 003
2307540.text: 'A'isha said, "Sawda, who was a heavy, sluggish woman, asked for permission to come in (to see the Prophet) on the night of Jam' (Muzdalifa) and he gave her permission."

2307550.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307550
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 004
2307550.text: Ibn Mas'ud said, "When the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, divided the booty of Hunayn at Ji'rana, the people crowded up against him. Then the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, 'Allah sent on of His slaves to a people and they rejected him and wounded him in the head. He wiped the blood from his brow, saying, "O Allah, forgive my people for they do not know."'"

2307560.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307560
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 005
2307560.text: Abu'l-Haytham said, "Some people came to 'Uqba ibn 'Amir and said, 'We have some neighbours who drink (wine) and behave incorrectly. Shall we bring them before the ruler?' 'No,' he replied, 'I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, "Whoever sees the fault of a Muslim and then veils it, it is as if he brought girl buried alive back to life from her grave.''"

2307570.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307570
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 006
2307570.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "When you hear a man saying, 'People are destroyed,' then he has destroyed them."

2307580.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307580
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 007
2307580.text: 'Abdullah ibn Burayda reported from his father that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Do not call a hypocrite 'master'. He is not your master and you will have angered your Lord, the Mighty and Exalted."

2307590.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307590
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 008
2307590.text: 'Adi ibn Arta' said, "When one of the Companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was praised, he said in supplication to Allah), 'Do not take me to task for what they say and forgive me for what they do not know.'"

2307600.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307600
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 009
2307600.text: Abu Qilaba reported that 'Abdullah said to Abu Mas'ud - or Abu Mas'ud said to 'Abdullah, "What did you hear the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say about '(false) assertion?" He said, "It is a bad mount for a man."

2307610.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307610
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 010
2307610.text: 'Abdullah ibn 'Amr said, "Abu Mas'ud, what did you hear the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say about 'People who make false claims?" He replied, "I heard him say, 'A bad mount for a man' and I heard him say, 'Cursing a believer is like killing him.'"

2307620.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307620
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 011
2307620.text: Ibn 'Abbas said, "None of you should say about a thing which he does not know, 'Allah knows it' when Allah may know that it is other than what he said and thus he (tries to) teach Allah what he does not know. That is something terrible in Allah's sight."

2307630.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307630
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 012
2307630.text: Ibn Abbas said, "The Milky Way is one of the gates of the heavens. The rainbow is security from being destroyed by flood after the people of Nuh, peace be upon him."

2307640.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307640
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 013
2307640.text: Ibn al-Kawwa' asked 'Ali about the Milky Way. He said, "It is the water-trough (or loop of the bag) from which the heaven opens up flowing water."

2307650.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307650
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 014
2307650.text: Ibn 'Abbas said, "The rainbow is security for the people of the earth that they will not be drowned. The Milky Way is the door of the heavens and forms a furrow through it."

2307660.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307660
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 015
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 015
2307660.text: Abu'l-Harith al-Kirmani heard a man say to Abu Raja', "I greet you and I ask Allah to join both of us together in the Abiding Abode of His mercy." Abu Raja' said, "Is anyone capable of that?" He continued, "What is the Abiding Abode of His mercy?" "The Garden," the man replied. "That is not correct," he said. The man asked, "Then what is the Abiding Abode of His mercy?" "The Lord of the Worlds," he replied.

2307670.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307670
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 016
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 016
2307670.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "None of you should say, 'May time (ad-Dahr) be disappointed. Allah is time (ad-Dahr)."

2307680.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307680
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 017
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 017
2307680.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "None of you should say, 'May time be disappointed!' Allah Almighty said, 'I am time (ad-Dahr). I send the night and the day. If I so wished, I could take them away.' None of you should the grape-vine 'karm" (instead of 'inab). Karm* is the Muslim man."

2307690.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307690
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 018
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 018
2307690.text: Mujahid said, "It is disliked for a man to stare at his brother or let his eye follow him when he turns his back or to ask, 'Where have you come from? Where are you going?'"

2307700.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307700
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 019
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 019
2307700.text: Anas reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, saw a man driving a sacrificial camel. "Ride it," he told him. The man replied, "It is a sacrificial camel." "Ride it," he repeated. The man said again, "It is a sacrificial camel." "Ride it," he repeated. The man said, "It is a sacrificial camel." The Prophet said, "Ride it, and bother you!"

2307710.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307710
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 020
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 020
2307710.text: Al-Miswar ibn Rifa'a al-Quruzi said, "I heard a man ask Ibn 'Abbas, 'Should I do wudu' after I have eaten bread and meat?' He replied, 'Woe to you! Would you do wudu' on account of good things?'"

2307720.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307720
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 021
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 021
2307720.text: Jabir said, "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was at al-Ji'rana on the Day of the Battle of Hunayn with the spoils in the custody of Bilal. The Prophet was dividing them out. A man came up to him and said, 'Be just! You are not being just!' The Prophet said, 'Bother you! Who will be just if I am not just?' 'Umar said, 'Messenger of Allah, let me strike off the head of the hypocrite!' The Prophet said, 'This man is with his followers who recite the Qur'an and it does not go beyond their throats. They pass through the deen as an arrow passes through the target (i.e. nothing of it remains on the arrow).'"

2307730.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307730
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 022
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 022
2307730.text: Bashir ibn Ma'bad as-Sadusi (whose name was Zahim ibn Ma'bad) made hijra (emigration) to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and the Prophet asked him, "What is your name?" "Zahim," he replied. The Prophet said, 'No, you are Bashir." Bashir said, "While I was walking with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, he passed the graves of some idolaters. He said, 'These people have missed much good' three times. Then he passed by the graves of the Muslims and observed, 'These people have obtained much good.' The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, suddenly looked up and saw a man wearing sandals walking among the graves. He said, 'You with the ox-hide sandals, take off your sandals!' When he saw the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, he removed his sandals and threw them away.'"

2307740.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307740
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 023
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 023
2307740.text: Muhammad ibn Hilal reported that he saw the rooms of the wives of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. The rooms were made of palm trunks covered with hair. The transmitter (Muhammad ibn Abi Fudayk) said, "I asked him about 'A'isha's room and he said, 'Its door faced Syria.' I asked, 'Was it one or two spans?' 'Its door was one span,' he replied. I asked, 'And what was it made of?' He said, 'From cypress or teak wood.'"

2307750.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307750
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 024
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 024
2307750.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The Final Hour will not come until houses' adornments resemble painted garments."

2307760.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307760
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 025
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 025
2307760.text: Abu Hurayra said, "A man came to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and said, 'Messenger of Allah, which sadaqa has the best reward?' He said, 'By your father, you will learn of it. It is that you give sadaqa while you are healthy and avaricious, fearful of poverty and desirous of wealth. You should not delay it until you are at the point of death and then say, "This much is for so-and-so. This much is for so-and-so. This much is for so-and-so."'"

2307770.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307770
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 026
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 026
2307770.text: 'Abdullah said, "When one of you seeks something he needs, he should ask for something small. He will have what is decreed for him. None of you should go to his companion and then praise him and thus break his back."

2307780.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307780
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 027
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 027
2307780.text: Abu 'Izza Yassar ibn 'Abdullah al-Hudhali reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "When Allah wants a slave to die in a particular country, he makes him have some reason for being there."

2307790.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307790
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 028
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 028
2307790.text: Abu 'Abdu'l-'Aziz said, "Abu Hurayra spent the night with us and looked at a star before him. Then he said, 'By the One who holds Abu Hurayra in his hand, some people wish that they would be appointed commanders in the earth while their actions are as if they were handing from that star. They are not appointed to those positions of command not to those positions.' Then he turned to me and said, 'May the one who hates you not have good! Is all of this allowed by the people of the east in the east?' 'Yes, by Allah,' I replied. He said, 'May Allah make them ugly and drive them like angry camels as if their faces were beaten shields until they give the owner of a field his field and the owner of sheep his sheep!'"

2307810.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307810
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 030
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 030
2307810.text: Ibn 'Abbas said, "A man said, to the Prophet, 'Whatever Allah wills and you will.' He said, 'You have put an equal with Allah. It is what Allah alone wills.'"

2307820.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307820
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 031
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 031
2307820.text: 'Abdullah ibn Dinar said, "I went out with 'Abdullah ibn 'Umar to the market. He passed by a small slave-girl who singing and remarked, 'Shaytan. If he had left anyone, he would have left this girl.'"

2307830.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307830
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 032
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 032
2307830.text: Anas ibn Malik heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, "I have nothing to do with diversions and diversions have nothing to do with me." He meant that he does not do anything worthless."

2307840.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307840
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 033
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 033
2307840.text: Ibn 'Abbas said about "There are some people who trade in distracting tales" (31:5) that it means singing and things like it.

2307850.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307850
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 034
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 034
2307850.text: Al-Bara' ibn 'Azib reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Spread the greeting to people and you will be safe. The saw is evil."

2307860.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307860
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 035
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 035
2307860.text: Fadala ibn 'Ubayd was at a meeting when he heard that some people were playing backgammon. He got up in anger to forbid it in the strongest possible terms. Then he said, "The one who plays in order to live on his winnings is like a person who eats pig meat and does wudu' in blood."

2307870.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307870
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 036
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 036
2307870.text: Ibn Mas'ud was heard to say, "You are living at a time when there are many men of understanding and few orators. There are few who ask and many who give. In it there is more action than diversion. After you there will come a time when there are few men of understanding and many orators. There will be many who ask and few who give. Guidance in it directs action. Know that right guidance at the end of time is better than some actions."

2307880.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307880
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 037
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 037
2307880.text: Abu't-Tufayl said, "I was asked, 'Did you see the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace?' 'Yes,' I replied, 'and I do not know of any man left alive on the face of the earth except myself who saw the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.' He went on, 'The Prophet had white skin and a handsome face.'"

2307890.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307890
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 038
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 038
2307890.text: Ibn 'Abbas reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Right guidance, correct behaviour and being moderate form a twenty-fifth portion of prophethood."

2307900.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307900
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 039
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 039
2307900.text: It is related that 'Ikrima said, "I asked 'A'isha, 'Did you ever hear the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, quoting poetry?' She replied, 'Sometimes when he entered a house, he would say, "News will come to you from someone you do not furnish with travel provisions."*'"

2307910.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307910
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 040
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 040
2307910.text: Ibn 'Abbas said, "This is something that a Prophet said, 'News will come to you from someone you do not furnish with travel provisions' (meaning that he had quoted it."

2307920.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307920
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 041
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 041
2307920.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "When one of you wishes for something, he should look to what he desires. He does not know what he will be given."

2307930.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307930
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 042
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 042
2307930.text: 'Alqama ibn Wa'il reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "None of you should say 'kurm.' Rather use 'habala' for grape-vines."

2307950.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307950
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 044
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 044
2307950.text: Hamna bint Jahsh said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, 'What is it, O person?'"

2307960.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307960
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 045
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 045
2307960.text: Habib ibn Sabhan al-Asadi said, "I saw 'Ammar praying the obligatory prayer. Then he said to a man at his side, 'O person!' Then he got up."

2307970.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307970
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 046
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 046
2307970.text: Ash-Sharid said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, rode with me behind him and said, "Do you know any of the poetry of Umayya ibn Abi's-Salt?' 'Yes,' I replied and recited a line. 'Go on,' he said, until I had recited a hundred lines."

2307980.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307980
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 047
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 047
2307980.text: 'A'isha said, "Do not forget to stand up at night to pray. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, did not neglect to do it. If he was either ill or lazy, he prayed sitting down."

2307990.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307990
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 048
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 048
2307990.text: Anas ibn Malik said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to often say, 'O Allah, I seek refuge with You from worry, sorrow, incapacity, laziness, cowardice, avarice, being overburdened by debt and being overcome by other men.'"

2308010.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308010
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 050
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 050
2308010.text: Abu Dharr said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, went towards al-Baqi' and I began to follow him. He turned and saw me and said, 'Abu Dharr!' I said, 'At your service, Messenger of Allah. May I be your ransom.' He said, 'Those who are rich will be poor on the Day of Rising except those who say, "Such-and-such and such-and-such is for a right (which was performed)."' I said, 'Allah and His Messenger know best.' He said, 'That is how it is' three times. Then we came to Uhud. He said, 'Abu Dharr!' I replied, 'At your service, Messenger of Allah. May I be your ransom.' He said, 'It would not delight me if Uhud were to become gold for the family of Muhammad and then have them spend a night with a dinar - or he said a mithqal.' Then we were at a wadi and he went ahead, so I thought that he felt a call of nature, and so I sat down at the edge of the wadi. He was gone a long time and I feared for him. Then I heard him and it seemed as if he were talking to a man. Then he came out to me my himself. I said, 'Messenger of Allah, who was the man you were talking to?' 'Did you hear him?' he asked. I said, 'Yes.' He said, 'That was Jibril. He came to me and gave me the good news that whoever of my community dies without associating anything with Allah will enter the Garden.' I said, 'Even if he commits adultery or steals?' He said, 'Yes.'"

2308020.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308020
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 051
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 051
2308020.text: 'Abdullah ibn Shaddad said, "I heard 'Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, say, 'I did not see the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, saying, ("May my father and mother be) your ransom" after Sa'd. I heard him say to him, "May my father and mother be your ransom."'"

2308030.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308030
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 052
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 052
2308030.text: 'Abdullah ibn Burayda related that his father said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, went out to the mosque while Abu Musa was reciting and asked, 'Who is this?' 'I am Burayda,' I replied, 'May I be your ransom!' He said, 'This man has been given one of the flutes of the family of Da'ud.'"

2308040.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308040
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 053
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 053
2308040.text: As-Sa'b ibn Hakim reported that his grandfather said, "I came to 'Umar ibn al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him. He began to say, 'Nephew.' Then he questioned me and I told him my lineage and so he knew that my father had not become Muslim. He began to say, 'My son, my son.'"

2308050.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308050
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 054
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 054
2308050.text: Anas said, "I used to serve the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace." He continued, "I used to enter without asking for permission to enter. One day I came and he said, 'My son, there is a new situation. You should not come in unless you have permission.'"

2308060.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308060
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 055
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 055
2308060.text: Ibn Abi Sa'sa'sa reported from his father that Abu Sa'id al-Khudri called him "my son".

2308070.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308070
In-book reference  : Book 33, Hadith 056
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 33, Hadith 056
2308070.text: 'A'isha reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "None of you should say, 'khabuthat nafsi'. He should say, 'Laqisat nafsi.'"
